You can judge the camera based on how well it performs indoor with artificial lighting conditions and this has done good. Attached pic of cake which I clicked indoor only bright light source was candle. It performed well I can say.(To people who complaint about camera -  I just cannot expect picture clarity of Apple or Samsung high end devices, i have to set my expectations right for the price we have paid)4. AnTuTu Benchmark Score - While company claim of 740000+ while I tested i got a score of 700000+ . I again cannot complaint here because I don't know what was the testing conditions and criteria that company had followed while testing. 700000+ is pretty decent score I can say5. Phone lag - In two days of testing it has not lagged at all. With multiple background apps running.6. Battery Drain - Revisit few of the settings on your device, like animation, transition effect etc to get most out of your battery. While I started to write this review my cell phone was at 100%. Now it's almost 25 min typing till now it's now showing 99%, i have set my screen at full brightness, i fell its decent. Also tested charging speed 0 to 50 in 12.03 min.7. Build quality - It's sturdy and decent plastic is used. I can say at this price point they should have provided glass build but again considering all price benefit you have got while buying this phone no complaint (Card Discount + Exchange Benefit etc) . Still I would take out 1 star here.8. Black colour issue - Did not face any problem with screen leak or black colour. It's AMOLED screen. Black is highlight of AMOLED. BGMI - I played few rounds yesterday and did not face any frame drop or lag.10. Two year warranty - They calaimed to provide two year warranty on this device but during registration it shows only 1 year. I have personally wrote to Iqoo team and Amazon team seeking an answer, with screenshots waiting for answer.BTW majority of phone manufacturers provide 1 year warranty only, even iPhone. Here I would say fight for you justice and seek answer from Iqoo or Amazon Team.11. Video call lag - Did not face any, did multiple video calls yesterday with different people, did not get any complaint from them about my video lag. For all of them my video popped up instantaneous.Overall I would say I had a great buy and can recommend this device to others , for all the folks bombarding negative reviews, I would say first set your expectations right and you will be satisfied. In case even still you are facing problem then you have every right to complaint and get justice.Overall i give this device a 4 star as of now since I am yet to test this device long term like 3 months or 4 months.*Please excuse any typos or grammatical errors if any. Detailed review after using for 1 month--Brief background: Phones I had considered before buying the neo 6: Iqoo 9 SE, Moto edge 30, Poco F4, Oneplus 9RT, Realme GT2.1. Build quality: Despite the back being plastic.. it's built is pretty good. The back panel feels premium and after applying the clear case (included in box) noone will be able to tell if it's plastic back or glass back unless they remove the case and feel it for themselves. Frame is also plastic and imo it will get small amount of scratches over a period of time. Rating 8/10.2. Design: It's everyone's personal preference. For me, I like it's design and would probalby give a high rating of 8/10 for it's looks.3. In hand feel: It's weight distribution is pretty good and it feels solid in hand. Nothing to complain about here. Rating 9/10.4. Display: The E4 amoled used is easily amongst the best at this price range. The colors are very good..blacks are deep and no tint issue either. Supports HDR 10+ . Further, the bezels and chin are pretty thin and you won't notice them after applying the case. Though there are phones that offer even thinner bezels like moto edge 30 and even poco F4 but this slight difference won't matter unless you put them side by side. For its price I would rate it 9/10 here.5. Speakers: Pretty good. Though slightly treble centric and less bassy, the clarity and loudness is pretty good. Rating 8/10.6. Performance: SD 870 along with iqoo's optimization and 120hz RR makes this one of the best performance phones upto 30k. You won't find any lag or jittering in any day to day task. It's fluid in everything. Rating 10/10.7. Gaming: Only played bgmi(pubg) and I have been impressed by it's endurance. I have played for 4 continuous hours and it doesn't get heated. Further, it doesn't throttle the performance even after 4 hours. It provides constant 60 fps in majority of scenarios barring a few like bootcamp hot drop where it might drop a few frames but even then nothing comes close to its performance upto 30k. (though the poco F4 is almost as good). Rating 9/10.8. Cameras: Now comes the real test as cameras are very important to me.Selfie: The best selfie phone till 30k. Skin tones, details, color science everything is on point. Rating 10/10.Back camera: The main 64MP sensor clicks beautiful images. The colors are slightly boosted but in a way that makes it look more pleasing(vivo's algorithm). The night mode is really functional and captures a lot of light in dark scenarios. Rating: 9/10.Ultrawide: It's not bad but also not impressive. Though the color science and image quality is pretty decent but owing to the 8MP sensor, the details are sometimes missing. They should have given the 13MP sensor of the 9SE. Rating 6/10.Macro: Useless.Videography: Pretty good again. Rating 9/109. Battery: Amongst the best in this price range. Under normal usage, it will easily last 1.5 days. On heavy usage, it will still last a day.Add to it the 80W fast charging that charges it fully in 33 minutes from 9% to 100% when i measured. No complaints here either. Rating 10/10.10. Software: Funtouch OS has improved a lot lately and it has become pretty decent. Though there are some bugs and glitches which sometimes ruin the experience and other OS like color and realme are better, it's manageable imo and not that bad either. It offers a lot of customisation features and majority of the bloatware can be uninstalled. Rating 7/10.Conclusion: IMO, it's the best value for money phone that you can buy right now.It literally doesn't have any major con. Though the Poco F4 comes close but trusting Poco after seeing their past 2 year track record is difficult.One important argument:Some people complain about it's plastic back which to some extent is justified at this price point. Glass looks more premium and will not get scratches over time. However, they should note that:1. Plastic helps in better heat dissipation, hence better thermals.2. There's no risk of it getting breaked if the phone accidentally falls( glass back can break even if its GG5)3. The plastic used is not cheap. In fact you won't be able to tell it's plastic unless you hold it in hand and feel it. Further, I think the back panel will get very less scratches seeing it's quality. Only the frame is more susceptible to scratches.4. 99% of people use the phone with a case. So plastic or glass back should be the last point of debate while buying a phone imo.Will add to this in case I have missed any point.
